column4: ubuntu doesn't support kde, but i it possible to install kde with debian sources ?
you can install KDE 3.2 from universe
I also have some KDE 3.3 debs but they don't work just now
why would they need an absolute path to the icon, that would go against the icon spec and good practice
ask gnome devs, it's gnome that uses absolute path
eclipse.desktop have absolute path to the icon
that's crazy and I refuse to believe the spec allows or encourages it, it should be an icon name and the icon loader looks in the relevant paths to find it
so I put the absolute path ad it workd
what did it have before and what did it have after?
anyway I don't like how ubuntu handle aliens applications to gnome
kubuntu dapper runs fine for me
